newsitem.title: FRANCE: SocGen eyes alliance with Paribas - paper.
newsitem.headline: SocGen eyes alliance with Paribas - paper.

text.p: French bank Societe Generale is eyeing an alliance with financial holding company Paribas, the business daily La Tribune reported on Thursday.
It said the bank, which reported on Wednesday 1996 profits jumped 19 percent to 4.54 billion francs, believes it may need an alliance to pursue its various ambitions.
The newspaper said the bank's chairman, Marc Vienot, had virtually ruled out a merger between Societe Generale and rival Banque Nationale de Paris (BNP).
Instead, it quoted Vienot as saying it "would be more logical for a bank like ours to get together with a French investment bank such as Paribas".

The newspaper also quoted Daniel Bouton, managing director of the bank and regarded as Vienot's heir apparent, as saying: "We're not necessarily strong as we would like to be in all our activities and in all parts of the world."
Even the "biggest banks need to grow, and that is true for Paribas or Societe Generale," Bouton said.
Speculation about restructuring in the French banking sector has been helping drive up shares of banks in recent months.
